title.narrative: Enhancing food security of vulnerable drought-affected households in Badghis Province

description.narrative:
Badghis province has been among the most affected provinces as result of the drought, the IPC report for October 2017 had listed Badghis the only province in Afghanistan that has been classified in phase 4 (emergency) and the fewsnet organization predicts Badghis to be among the few provinces which will be at the stage of emergency through early 2019. In the recent multi-sector assessment conducted by WVA in Badghis, 78% of the households rated the food security situation “a lot worse” compare to the same time last year and 21% rated it as “worse” compared to last year. Majority of the surveyed households estimated that their current cereal stock last for 0.07 months (2.1 days), whereas they estimated an average of 4 months cereal stock for the same time last year showing the dire food insecurity being faced by households.
In line with the Food Security and Agriculture Cluster Priorities for this allocation, life-saving food assistance is required to increase vulnerable drought-affected households' access to nutritious foods. WV proposes to distribute essential life-saving food assistance to 2700 drought affected vulnerable food insecure households in 5 districts of Badghis,
Additionally, the second component of the project, which focuses on livelihood protection is aligned to the Food Security and lIvelihoods cluster priorities "Distribution of livestock feed/fodder and veterinary services to protect livestock asset depletion" and Provision of agriculture inputs for the winter crop to ensure farmers ability to cultivate". WV proposes to drought tolerant wheat seed to 2700 drought affected vulnerable households in the 5 districts of Badghis. WV also proposes to distribute survival supplementary fodder to an additional 2700 households with small and large ruminants that are at risk of death due to fodder shortages. The proposed interventions are in line with the allocation strategy for 2018 standard allocation 2.
The proposed project will target households classified in phase 4 (emergency). The beneficiaries will be identified through eligibility criteria through a customized assessment tool. Food assistance will be provided to extremely food insecure drought-affected households (50% ration for 4 months) who have not received any food assistance support from WFP or other partners. The animal feed/fodder will be provided to the beneficiaries who have suffered the loss of their livestock as result of drought and still have up to 3 large ruminants and up-to 7 small ruminants. These beneficiaries will receive a ration of animal feed/fodder of 100 kg concentrated fodder. The drought-resistant wheat seed will be provided to the beneficiaries who have rain-fed land but no seed for cultivation. These beneficiaries will receive 50 kg of drought-resistant wheat seeds. These will be selected based on their vulnerability status, coupled with reliance on crop production as their major food source. the project will prioritise women headed and elderly households as the main target for the project.
